radiographic_examinations.findings: Moderately large bilateral pleural effusions, bilateral perihilar pulmonary edema, and cardiomegaly
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Five months before admission, there was a decrease in the pleural effusions and interstitial edema, but persistent cardiomegaly.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Enlargement of the right-sided pleural effusion to the level of the right hilum, with a small left-sided pleural effusion, pulmonary venous hypertension, and diffuse irregular interstitial opacities.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Persistent mild interstitial edema was noted; however, there had been a marked increase in the size of the right-sided pleural effusion.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.date: One and a half months before admission
radiographic_examinations.findings: No discrete hepatic lesions; bilateral pleural effusions were larger than in previous studies.
